It presents antigens to T cells and helps the immune system distinguish between self and non-self. HLA is not a disease itself, but it is associated with various diseases, including autoimmune diseases, transplant rejection, and certain infections.
2. Factor B: Factor B is a protein involved in the complement system, which is part of the innate immune response. It plays a role in the activation of the complement component C3. Deficiencies in Factor B can lead to diseases such as atypical hemolytic uremic syndrome (aHUS) and paroxysmal nocturnal hemoglobinuria (PNH).
